messages.subject: Re: Jury Duty - Off Topic
messages.msgSnippet: ... MAKING her drive? I begged to be allowed to drive half the days.  No go. Glenda (aka Speed Racer) loves to drive. I did insist on giving her my mileage
messages.messageBody:
----------
>From: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
>To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
>Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 2809
>Date: Tue, Jan 7, 2003, 12:26 PM
>

> << I carpooled with
> another juror, an 80-year-old world traveler who wanted to be a
> race car driver in her youth. I closed my eyes a lot as we drove to
> court each day. ;) >>
>
> So you were making the 80 year old drive?
> Was there a third in this carpool?


MAKING her drive? I begged to be allowed to drive half the days. <g> No go.
Glenda (aka Speed Racer) loves to drive. I did insist on giving her my
mileage checks from the court, however. ;)

Wally found her some car racing schools (where they put you behind the wheel
of a race car and teach you how to drive it) and I'm pretty sure she's going
to enroll in one.

No third in the carpool -- we tried to talk another juror into joining us
(we all live in the same town and were commuting to the county courthouse
each day, about 20+ miles away) but he said No Way once he'd seen Glenda
driving. And he's no coward, he's a local fireman. :)

Pam
